I have thinking maybe to flip the Grey and white, so white lower

I agree with that, if you look on the Soyuz and Progress photos you may see that the white pat is on the lower half of SM.

Tantares revamp looks beautiful! I just hope it won't break saves with the new part sizes.

What if you make the periscope an animated part of the descend module, instead of a different part?

Flamerboy, To embed IMGUR albums use the

curtquarquesso, Great MIR!

Here is a picture of my incomplete MIR with the new TAC file installed. As you can see, the TST Oxygen system, TST Water Purifier, and TST Bckup Oxygen generator can be toggled on or off.

If TAC fuel balancer is installed then it can be configured to automatically transfer oxygen, food, and water to the crewed modules, and move waste to the Progress. The TST generators use TaranisElsu's calculations, so they should keep the entire station supplied with enough oxygen and water for up to 8 kerbals.

I thought about adding a hydroponics module to the TKS's orbital block to convert waste+water into food, but I didn't add it because it seems too futuristic for Tantares' theme. If anyone's interested I can upload the config file with the hydroponics system.

[imgUR]a9BC6">Javascript is disabled. View full album

And a bonus, a shuttle launch with a Proton. The first stage lifted the light shuttle out of the atmosphere easily. Then something strange happened: it spun out of control as soon as it passed the 75,000m mark. I don't know why, but I could not get it to stabilize. The launch was a failure, but all of the parts were recovered. At least it produced some attractive screen shots!

On an unrelated note, I hate the MKII inline clamp. It is a real pain to use when docking, and it is non-functional in the SPH or VAB.

Javascript is disabled. View full album

curtquarquesso, Great MIR!

Here is a picture of my incomplete MIR with the new TAC file installed. As you can see, the TST Oxygen system, TST Water Purifier, and TST Bckup Oxygen generator can be toggled on or off.

If TAC fuel balancer is installed then it can be configured to automatically transfer oxygen, food, and water to the crewed modules, and move waste to the Progress. The TST generators use TaranisElsu's calculations, so they should keep the entire station supplied with enough oxygen and water for up to 8 kerbals.

I thought about adding a hydroponics module to the TKS's orbital block to convert waste+water into food, but I didn't add it because it seems too futuristic for Tantares' theme. If anyone's interested I can upload the config file with the hydroponics system.

http://imgur.com/a/a9BC6

And a bonus, a shuttle launch with a Proton. The first stage lifted the light shuttle out of the atmosphere easily. Then something strange happened: it spun out of control as soon as it passed the 75,000m mark. I don't know why, but I could not get it to stabilize. The launch was a failure, but all of the parts were recovered. At least it produced some attractive screen shots!

On an unrelated note, I hate the MKII inline clamp. It is a real pain to use when docking, and it is non-functional in the SPH or VAB.

http://imgur.com/a/3j3En

I just want the SM to be less scratched.I always loved your serious fresh from factory shiny style. Those "kerbaly" scratched parts are ugly for me.

Really nice!

Do RAPIERS confuse kerbal engineer that much?

It looks like a space bullet! Reminds me of Jules Verne's "From the Earth to the Moon"

Thanks! It is very easy to fly: it is perfectly balanced, and the wheel position means that it will lift off on its own. Just press the space bar and it will naturally assume a 10-15% incline. Unfortunately, the TWR is low and the lift is also low; fighter jets were not meant to go to orbit! Also, FAR limits the thrust of jets by 50% by default, and further limits the Rapier to the point where it's almost unusable for SSTO spaceplanes.

Here is the craft file if anyone wants to play around with it. Flying in NEAR or with the B9 engines makes it shoot up like a "space bullet".

http://puu.sh/eGNet/9b9861ef2a.jpg

I don't know why you would want to make a suicide ship (except when used as ferry craft), but heck yeah anyway!

EDIT: Oh, also, is the Mianbiao module going to get a makeover (at least in the texture aspect of things) to fit in with the new Soyuz?
